title._content: [Portrait of Stuff Smith, Kelly's Stable, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Stuff Smith, Kelly's Stable, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Stuff was with Red Allen and others at Kelly's, the 52nd St. spot between 6th and 7th that is doing a heroic job trying to lure the cats from their beaten path (about 150 yards further west on 52nd--a goodly distance when tanked). Stuff was recently shaken from the moth balls and restored good as new. He's missing his old top hat (good), still sings "I'se A-Muggin" (bad) and is rumored planning to go to Europe. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 457 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 7 (Sept. 46, 1946), p. 10. Subjects: Smith, Stuff Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Violinists--1940-1950. Fifty-second Street (New York, N.Y.)--1940-1950. Kelly's Stable Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig...
